result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant in court with Attorney Tim Kiefer.  Kyle Olsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defn has new charges to be filed. I/A to be set mid-June. Counsel request case track with new case. Defn to retain Atty Kiefer on new case.

$500 previously posted to apply.
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)]. 
- Defendant shall not make any acts or threats of violence against Breanna B.
Stipulated Motion to Modify Non-Monetary Bail Conditions- State of Wisconsin

Defendant in court with Attorney Tim Kiefer.  Kyle Olsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defn rec'd an offer and request another PTC to consider offer. Counsel advised next hearing may convert to PLEAS.
Pre-trial conference on June 6, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Signed bond form not returned; bail held

Adjustment Number: 22A 011033,
Payable Number: 558035,
Receipt Number: 22RS012752,
Amount: $20.00
Pre-trial conference on April 28, 2022 at 09:15 am.

CASH BAIL PREVIOUSLY POSTED OF $500 TO BE APPLIED TO THIS BOND, REMAINING BALANCE TO BE RETURNED TO THE POSTER. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Breanna B except while attending medical appointments or physical therapy appointments for their children, or through a third party only for the purposes of arranging child custody or placement, or through a third party only for the purposes of making health care decisions for their children. 
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)]. 
Trial Judge - Br 5 

Defendant has acknowledged and agreed to terms and conditions of bond. Defendant must return signed bond form within 10 days of today. Any bail money previously posted will not be returned until a signed bond form is on file with the Clerk of Courts.

10:58 AM Attorney Tim Kiefer in court on behalf of defendant.  Robin W Lee appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Appearance by victim. All parties by Zoom. The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts. Statement by victim.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 09:15 am.
